page.title: 17THE DAY OF A SCHOOLCHILD.
page.content: Pupils at Chilton Cantelo School have a hard life compared with our own school.The day begins at 7.15 a.m. when a bell wakes everyone. The first task is to tidy their rooms ready for inspection. At 7.40 a.m. they have a roll call followed by breakfast. The morning lessons last until 1.00 p.m. with only a half an hour break. After lunch they work until 5.00 p.m. and then they have tea. Homework is done for about one and a half hours. They are then free until lights out at 8.30 for juniors and for seniors at 10.30. Lessons are also given on Saturday mornings. For the rest of the weekend they can follow their own interests.Their lessons include such subjects as Maths, English, French, Science,Art and all sorts of sports. They wear green or blue jumpers with black or grey trousers or skirts.
